dialogues.speaker: ROOM, WHICH LOOKS OUT ON THE SEA. HE SMILES AT HER.
Unknown
dialogues.text: LECHTER COMES UP AND HOLDS HER CHAIR FOR HER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know you'd prefer "I'm glad you find me so..." LECHTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer you to say what you feel.  STARLING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that that smells so wonderful.  LECHTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you'll find it so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  It's good to see you regaining  your strength...  STARLING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, what were we last speaking of...?  STARLING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were speaking of my father...

dialogues.speaker: THE STOVE, WIPES HIS HANDS, AND RETURNS TO THE DININGROOM
Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we were speaking of my father...  LECHTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and my need for The Institution...  LECHTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freud, do you know...?  Freud  psychoanalyzed patients in One Afternoon.  STARLING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how did he do that?  LECHTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saw the truth, and spoke it...  STARLING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid, this wine is making me woozy...  LECHTER

dialogues.speaker: LECHTER RETURNS TO THE KITCHEN, INDICATING "ONE MOMENT."
Unknown
dialogues.text: THE KITCHEN, AND WE HALF-SEE THE TORSO OF A MAN SITTING IN A KITCHEN CHAIR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've sought out The Institution all  your life, as you with it to replace your Father.  This is obvious.  Less obvious is this:  that you require the  institution not to support you, but to

dialogues.speaker: PUTS THE GLASS DOWN, A TRIFLE WOOZY.
Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as this keeps your father alive.  The truth is two-fold, and the truth is one:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That every man is fallible, that every institution, being made of men, cannot but be corrupt...

dialogues.speaker: SCALPEL AND A SMALL MEDICAL SAW...
Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the only art in this dish, of course, is that it must be fresh...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SLUM ROOM. STARLING, DAZED, AND LECHTER, REENTERI
Unknown
dialogues.text: That the institution cannot but be  corrupt, and, therefore, it cannot be but an act of complicity to seek to appease it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many civilizations eat their slain enemies... what do you think...?  How much better to devour a person  physically, than to devour his spirit.  Which is, of course, the purpose of the institution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: :and that is the especial surprise, I've prepared for You!  STARLING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you must eat.  SHE LOOKS DOWN AT THE TABLE.  SHE PICKS UP HER FORK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gift, of course is not the meal-- but the identification--which of us does not need help?  The identity, of your true enemy...?  ...for you always sought to befriend, to wish the love of those who wished you ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here--he is in no pain, there are no nerves in the brain, come here...

dialogues.speaker: XEROX OF THE PHOTO OF THE BADGE WITH THE HOLE IN IT.
Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, I'm going to cure you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.  Oh, NO.  They've put a beeper on you.  How careless of me.  How finally  careless, Do you think?  Have I erred on Purpose?  Eh?  Or am I just unlucky?  Could one not say that's the essential question of Philosophy...?  ANGLE ON STARLING, DAZED, LOOKING ON. STARLING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might I have some more of the wine...?  ANGLE ON LECHTER, AS HE MOVES TO A BACK WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: STARLING, AS SHE RISES, AGAIN, IN HER BALLGOWN.
Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, I find I like the effects.  You may say that it's inebriation, but it seems

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lovely evening, in particular.... it  seems to reward me with clarity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....or perhaps, it is just the heat... I was just saying to the Doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, do you know, do you know, I'm not feeling altogether....  SHE SWOONS.  A SWAT MAN CATCHES HER. SWAT MAN

dialogues.speaker: SEVERAL MEN PROCEED TOWARD THE BACK OF THE KITCHEN.
Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get her out of here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as my father used to say... SWAT OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why it's a stone, you know, It means Don't Come Back.

dialogues.speaker: IN FRONT OF THE OLD TRUCK.
Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  No.  He can't come back.  MAPP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, that's the beginning of wisdom.  MAPP PUTS HER ARM AROUND STARLING, AS THEY WALK OFF.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON THE TWO WOMEN, AS STARLING LEANS IN.
ON MAPP, AS SHE LOOKS AT STARLING.
